description: With this command you can add, overwrite or remove records in a zone.
availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: UpdateDNSZone
Name of the zone that shall be modified.
Time to live of the whole zone
Master nameserver of the zone
Responsible person (mailadress with "@" substituted by ".") for the zone
Value that indicates the "actuality" of the SOA-Record to other nameservers. The soaserial must be increased (or at least incremented) on every zoneupdate
See the accordant RFC (listed below) for details
See the accordant RFC (listed below) for details
See the accordant RFC (listed below) for details
See the accordant RFC (listed below) for details
Increases the zone serial by 1 if submitted
Automatically resolve TTL conflicts if possible
When using "rr" as parameter in UpdateDNSZone, all existing records (besides the SOA record of course) will get deleted and replaced by the new records, defined by rr0, rr1, ...
Add one or more new DNS records to the zone. The existing records are not touched by this parameter. The new records are appended to the existing ones.
Delete one or more DNS records
Change status of the zone
Set special MX record in EXTENDED mode
Set special destination IP address in EXTENDED mode
Switch to EXTENDED mode to manage forwardings
Set zonemode to MASTER or SLAVE
Set the master nameserver in case the zonemode is SLAVE
DNSSEC mode, AUTO or DISABLED
